SEARCH

Class App

java.lang.Object
App
public class App extends Object
The main application class for the game. This class initializes the game map, player, and handles user input for gameplay.

  • Method Details

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      The main method to start the game.
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments (not used).
      Throws:
      Exception - If an unexpected error occurs during execution.

    • displayWelcomeBanner

      private static void displayWelcomeBanner(Scanner scanner)
      Displays the game’s ASCII welcome banner and prompts the user to start or quit.

      This method loops until a valid menu choice is entered: “1” to start the game (sets the static gameStart flag to true) or “2” to quit (prints a message and calls System.exit(0) to terminate the program).

      Parameters:
      scanner - the Scanner instance used for reading the user’s input

    • displayGameInstructions

      private static void displayGameInstructions(Player player)
      Displays the game instructions to the player.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object to personalize the instructions.

    • printCurrentLocation

      private static void printCurrentLocation(Player player, GameMap map)
      Prints the current location of the player on the map.
      Parameters:
      player - The player object representing the current player.
      map - The game map object.

    • processCommand

      private static void processCommand(String input, Player player, GameMap map, Scanner scanner)
      Processes a user command and updates the game state accordingly. Handles movement, map display, help, quitting, and invalid input.
      Parameters:
      input - The command entered by the user.
      player - The player object representing the current player.
      map - The game map object.
      scanner - The scanner object for reading user input.

    • handleUse

      private static void handleUse(Player player, GameMap map, Scanner scanner)
      Attempts to use an item or trigger an event at the player's current location.

      - At (2,3): powers up the AI terminal if the player has a Cryo Core. - At (0,0): activates the Rift Gate if the player has a Gate Key. - Otherwise: informs the player there is nothing to use here.

      Parameters:
      player - The player object, whose inventory will be checked and modified.
      map - The game map, used to retrieve and update the current location.
      scanner - The scanner for reading additional player input (e.g., confirmation).

    • confirm

      private static boolean confirm(String prompt, Scanner scanner)
      Prompts the user with a yes/no question and reads input until a valid response is given.
      Parameters:
      prompt - the message to display asking the user to confirm (e.g. "Are you sure? (y/n): ")
      scanner - the Scanner instance to read the user's input from
      Returns:
      true if the user entered 'y'; false if the user entered 'n'

    • handleSolve

      private static void handleSolve(Player player, Scanner scanner, GameMap map)
      Handles the “solve” command by checking for and attempting the puzzle at the player’s current coordinates.
      • At (3,1): Presents the Monolith riddle. On a correct answer (echo), grants a Gate Key and marks the puzzle as solved.
      • At (1,1): Presents the Strix Mastermind puzzle. On a correct answer (seven), grants a Cryo Core and marks the puzzle as solved.
      • Otherwise: Informs the player that there is no puzzle at this location.
      If a puzzle has already been solved at the location, the player is notified and no further action is taken.
      Parameters:
      player - the Player whose inventory may be updated with rewards
      scanner - the Scanner used to read the player’s answer
      map - the GameMap used to determine the player’s current Location
